alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 4:14PM MDT until August 16 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by moderate to heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, Colfax. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadway is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 411 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.50 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Colfax County - This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 358 and 374 as well as portions of State Route 72. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. The heavy rainfall and slow movement of these storms will result in flooding of road intersections, low lying areas and normally dry arroyos.
